bibdata.title: IEEE Standard for Local and metropolitan area networks -- Part 21: Media Independent Handover Services Amendment 4: Multicast Group Management
IEEE Standard for Local and metropolitan area networks -- Part 21: Media Independent Handover Services Amendment 4: Multicast Group Management
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Std 802.21d-2015 (Amendment to IEEE Std 802.21-2008 as amended by IEEE Std 802.21a-2012, IEEE Std 802.21b-2012, and IEEE Std 802.21c-2014)

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: Mechanisms to enable multicast group management for MIH services is specified in this standard. The specification defines management primitives and messages that enable a user to join, leave or update group membership and security mechanisms to protect multicast communication.

Mechanisms to enable multicast group management for MIH services is specified in this standard. The specification defines management primitives and messages that enable a user to join, leave or update group membership and security mechanisms to protect multicast communication.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
